definition: Holland/the Netherlands/abbr. for 荷蘭|荷兰[He2 lan2]
to carry on one's shoulder or back/burden/responsibility
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu

sentences.english: The Dutch verb has both notions present in it, denoting both tangling and unweaving.
sentences.chinese: 荷蘭語的這個詞兩個意思都有，既指纏起來又指鬆開。

sentences.english: Afrikaans is blossoming in the liberal New South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 南非荷蘭語在自由主義的新南非相當流行。

sentences.english: Their name comes from South Africa's Afrikaans language and means "earth pig."
sentences.chinese: 他們的名字源於南非的荷蘭語意思是“泥豬”。

sentences.english: If you spoke Dutch, you were at the top.
sentences.chinese: 如果你說荷蘭語，那你就是上流社會的人。

sentences.english: Illiterate her whole life, she spoke Dutch-accented English.
sentences.chinese: 她一生沒有讀過書，說英文帶有荷蘭語口音。

sentences.english: The country has since developed a bilingual Dutch-French system.
sentences.chinese: 之後，比利時逐漸成爲荷蘭語和法語雙語體系國家。

definition: pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
Dresden, capital of Saxony 薩克森州|萨克森州[Sa4 ke4 sen1 zhou1], Germany
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
the name of various newspapers, notably Le Monde (France), El Mundo (Spain) and Die Welt (Germany)
